translated: The Chapter with Kaṇikāra Flower Similes
Having made a bow that cannot be bent,
having cut a flower with a stalk,
I offered it to the Buddha.
the flower I offered to the Buddha;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
there was one who held the sun;
I have done what the Buddha’s instruction requires.”🔽Thus the elder Salalamāli recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā salalamāliyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Salalamāliyattherassāpadānaṁ sattamaṁ.
